description: Ms. codex. Spine title. Physical description: 24 lines per page; written in naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Damp-staining and insect damage, mainly marginal; repairs to leaves at the beginning and end. Origin: Part 1 completed 23 Shawwāl 1091 H [16 November 1680], by Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusaynī al-Ḥarārī al-Shīrāzī (leaf 176a).
author: Shahīd al-Awwal, Muḥammad ibn Makkī, 1333 or 1334-1380
abstract: Treatise on Shiʻite law; incomplete at beginning and end.
extent: 227 leaves : paper ; 266 x 194 (212 x 119) mm bound to 267 x 196 mm
title: Durūs
provenance: Owner's stamp of Ṣadr al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī on first flyleaf.
creator: شهيد الاول، محمد بن مكي، 1333 or 1334-1380
subject: Islamic law—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Full brown leather with gold-stamped central mandorla and pendants and blind-tooled fillets; yellow paper doublures.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
